I didn't really care for the Blade: Houe of Chthon... it was lame and you get left not knowing how anything ends and having different actor as Blade didn't really settle well and the film was rather B-rated. Wesley Snipes was the best thing about Blade; you can't make another movie without him.

reviewText: Although aspects of this trilogy can be a little silly, these movies find just the right balance between recognizing their own limitations and transcending them. Well done. Take special note of the really excellent soundtrack on all three.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: I didn't enjoy nor appreciate the Blade movies when they first came out.  I thought the first one was shallow and music video flashy splashy when it came out and that prejudiced me against the sequels.  I was bored so I bought this great deal really because Stephen Dorf owns his petiteness and still BURNS.  So everything's going along reasonably entertaining.  NBushe Wright isn't as pretty as she is in Fresh but she's still a great example of West African pretty and physical harmony.  Part One - Vampires are bad, m'kay and the drafted/turned are no better than the enlisted/purebloods.  Part Two is when I start to realize there's a message beyond Vampires are Bad, M'Kay viz. hybrids bred to more effectively kill mankind  are worth nothing to their vampire parents and unconditional love from a child to a parent can be killed and the child can betray the parent. Part Three is about the unforgivableness of familiars and about Dominic Purcell as evil incarnate.  It doesn't go away and it can look like anyone.  It can walk in the sunlight and look like your favorite person.  So instead of just being box office moneymakers, these movies are well-told lessons.  Part Four is just to show by comparison how well done the original three movies are.
summary: He only kills humans who are vampire familiars.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: Wesley Snipes did an outstanding job in the movies Blade; Blade 2; and Blade Trinity.  In Blade he battles with (Actor Stephen Dorff) who plays a vampire set on becoming the ultimate vampire by using Blade's blood to destroy the vampire elders; and possess their combined powers. These powers will make him stronger than any force; and totally immune to sunlight.Blade 2 takes the viewer in a little different direction.  There is a disease running rampant through the vampire and human populace, which causes the host body to mutate into something truly subhuman and almost impossible to defeat.  Blade joins forces with a team of ninja like vampires, in hopes of wiping out the mutants thereby preserving the vampire and human races.Blade Trinity is the final chapter of the Snipes Collection wherein Blade starts out by killing what appears to be two vampires, which turns out to be only half right.  Upon killing the second vampire he discovers though the first of the two was a real vampire, the second was merely a familiar or more accurately a human who does a vampire's bidding.  Blade has been set up and is on the run, but ultimately captured!  He is then sprung from jail by his ex mentor's daughter and her friends...and is intangled in a plan to destroy Dracula and his evil vampire pals, who released him from his tomb.  Their hope is to possess his powers...and become daywalkers like Blade.  The fourth installment in this collection is the first episode from the miniseries Blade starring Kirk Jones, which I have already rated.  Each movie has a great storyline...and when you combine it with all the out of this world special effects; sword play; and Snipes other moves, "Well it just doesn't get any better than that folks!"
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: I had never seen these movies and they are not on Netflix streaming. After reading reviews from people who have compared the blu-ray version against the DVD I started to incline towards the DVD set. When I saw it new, for $4.99 and 99 cent shipping at another popular web site, it was a no-brainer. I loved them all. And I knew the 4th DVD was a TV pilot, so I knew what to expect. I dislike unnecessary swearing but here it seemed so natural and even "well used", not cheesy at all. Not High Definition, but crisp, very sharp and colorful. I don't always need High Def to enjoy a movie, even on my 55 inch screen. The reason for the 4 stars is the packaging. I got 4 discs, I think it used to be 2 (I prefer 4), but they were piled on top of each other, like pancakes. The top one (!st movie) was loose, when I got the package out of the mail box I could feel and hear it bouncing around. It had some scratches but fortunately there was no pixelation during viewing, so I didn't have to exchange it. I have some old 3-DVD cases so I changed the case and put the 4th in an envelope where an insert pamphlet is supposed to go. Although I'm still a big fan of the Supernatural TV show, I can see where they got the idea for the car (and some other things). As with Back to the Future, now I am wishing for a 4th movie. I am pretty happy with my purchase.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: If you don't like Blade please stand up. Since we are all sitting down I can tell you about the Blade Collection. As you can see this collection contains Blade 1,2,and 3. In addition to that we also get the House of Chthon TV show pilot. I was never really sure about the pilot, since it had a different actor as Blade. But I was quite pleasantly surprised by it. It's not quite as good as the other movies, but it can definitely hang. The collection is in 5.1 Dolby Digital and it also has extra features like commentaries and such. There is a whole lot in this little box. I think it's a great buy.

reviewText: This is a reivew of the set and not the movies.  Surprisingly, the quality of these DVDs is pretty good.  There is some pixelation on my 52 inch flat screen, but much less than I expectetd.  Very watchable, although for die hard fans of the series, I would probably recommend going with the single disc or blu ray version.  The reason for my 3 stars, is not the quality of the transfer, but the packaging...definitely lacking here. Unfortunately, the sleeve/flap for the first disc rests awkwardly, directly on top of the 2nd dvd, creating a number of obvious scratches.  I returned my copy for a new one (at target, not amazon) and received the same thing, with the scratches in almost the exact same distribution.  Skipping has been minimal, but is probably variable and may depend on your player.  For those of you who will be dissatisfied with scratched discs, I can imagine that the great majority of these sets will have at least a few scratches.  For those who don't mind a few scratches and a little pixelation, this will probably be a nice buy.

reviewText: I was looking for a copy of Blade II (Just for Norman Reedus as Scud... ♥) but, for few cents more, I could get all 4 movies. Sold! I was pleasantly surprised that the movies are actually pretty entertaining! Cheesy, but entertaining! The packaging is the only issue I have with this set. 4 DVDs stacked together in one case with zero separation or protection between the discs. The center post where you secure the discs is longer than on a single disc DVD case so, it was obviously designed to have all 4 discs stacked together (The seller didn't just throw loose DVDs into a single replacement case.). I'll have to get paper sleeves or jewel cases to keep the discs from scratching against each other...

reviewText: Below is a review of this product:4 Film Favorites - Blade Collection.  Amazon may display this review on the page of another version of this product, for which this review may not apply.  After reading this review, please click on the link so that you can be assured that the product this review applies to is the same one you thought it was for.--------------------------------------------------### ABOUT THE 4 FILM FAVORITES SERIES ###Warner Brothers/New Line's "4 Film Favorites" is a line of two-disc sets consisting of four films that are part of a series/franchise or center around a common theme.  Each disc is dual-sided, with the contents of each side being a bit-for-bit copy (a "disc image") of a previous DVD release.  Usually the very first DVD release of a film is used as the master for each side, which could be either single-layer or dual-layer.  If the DVD master that is used first came out at the infancy of DVD production (the late 1990s), there may be little to no extras, and even a poor film transfer when compared to a later re-release.  Also, if that original release was a two-disc set, or a dual-sided disc (see: Lethal Weapon 4), only Disc 1 or Side A will be used.  The "4 Film Favorites" line is priced with the budget-conscience consumer in mind, with Target having the lowest price at 9.99 each (occasionally on sale for 8.99).  Other stores will inevitably be priced higher, though I don't recommend paying more than ten dollars for each two-disc set.### ABOUT THE BLADE COLLECTION ###BLADE* Year: 1998* Runtime: 2:00:07* Video Format: 16:9 Widescreen* DVD Production Date: February 25, 2002 (Nero InfoTool gives this date, but it should be 1998 or 1999)* Region: 1* Layers: 2* Audio Languages: English* Subtitle Languages: English* Extras: Commentary by Wesley Snipes and others (Stephen Dorff, David S. Goyer, Theo Van De Sande, Kirk M. Petruccelli, Peter Frankfurt), Isolated Score with Commentary by composer Mark Isham, "La Magra" Featurette, "Designing Blade" Featurette, "The Origins Of Blade" Featurette, "The Blood Tide" Featurette, "House Of Erebus" (explanation of the twelve Vampire Glyphs), "Pencil To Post" Sketch Gallery, Cast & Crew Bios & Filmographies (Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff, Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright, Donal Logue, Stephen Norrington, David S. Goyer, Peter Frankfurt, Theo Van De Sade, Kirk M. Petruccelli, Mark Isham), Theatrical Trailer, DVD-ROM Content (Entire Screenplay).* Notes: The back of the case incorrectly lists "Real Time Storyboards While You Watch The Movie" as an extra.BLADE II* Year: 2002* Runtime: 1:56:43* Video Format: 16:9 Widescreen* DVD Production Date: October 14, 2003* Region: 1* Layers: 2* Audio Languages: English* Subtitle Languages: English* Extras: NoneBLADE: TRINITY* Year: 2004* Runtime: 1:52:46* Video Format: 16:9 Widescreen, 4:3 Fullscreen* DVD Production Date: February 25, 2005* Region: 1* Layers: 2* Audio Languages: English* Subtitle Languages: English, Spanish* Extras: None* Notes: This is the R-Rated Theatrical cut (an Unrated cut also exists).  This is actually Disc 1 from what was originally a two-disc set.  The back of the case incorrectly lists 2 commentaries and an isolated score track as extras.BLADE: HOUSE OF CHTHON* Year: 2006* Runtime: 1:28:40* Video Format: 16:9 Widescreen* DVD Production Date: February 7, 2008* Region: 1* Layers: 2* Audio Languages: English* Subtitle Languages: English, Spanish* Extras: Commentary by director Peter O'Fallon, Commentary by writers David Goyer and Geoff Johns, "Turning Blade" Documentary, 8 Spike TV Promos, DVD Ads (The Butterfly Effect 2, Undisputed II: Last Man Standing, Tenacious D In The Pick Of Destiny, Pan's Labyrinth, The Number 23, Superman: Doomsday, Doctor Strange).* This is the feature-length premiere episode of the "Blade: The Series" television series that aired on Spike in 2006.  This is also Disc 1 in theBlade: The Series - The Complete SeriesDVD set.
summary: A Sharp Collection, But Lack Of Extras On Two Films Dulls It A Bit

reviewText: What can be said about Blade?  The timeline is switched from that of the comics to relatively present day which I always felt was a pity. A Blade with an English accent and Barnaby St attire would've been neat. The first two movies are the better but the third, with its Dracula theme looks as if everyone is simply going through their paces.  Some faces who've become more recognizable since these movies were made. The first movie is perhaps the best with Stephen Dorff as Deacon Frost.  It's too bad the series didn't get a second season. That showed some promise.  In this day of the Hollywood Rerun, I"m thinking it's time for a Blade remake. Until then, watch the first Blade and save the others for a rainy day.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: Blade is a fun series of movies - the first was great, second was decent (and done by Del Toro - didnt know that), third was pretty stupid, and the TV movie was pretty good - enjoyed the series and was bummed it ended so soon.The bad - packaging! Granted, for the price, but still all 4 disks just sitting on top of one another is a crummy way to package a movie set - maybe two movies on one disk with a sleeve and two disks or something...but stacked just ensures the disks will be damaged over time.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: Anyone that likes vampire movies will love all of the Blade movies. These are great movies that have a lot of action and a lot of fight scenes. The choreography of the fight scenes are excellent and a lot of the scenes have you on the edge of the seat anticipating what will happen next. You can't help but root for and fall in love with Blade(Wesley Snipes). These are some of Snipes best movies. Although the last movie House of Chthon didn't have Snipes in as Blade it was still a very good movie. "Sticky Fingers" portrayal of Blade was awesome and if there had to be someone replacing Wesley Snipes then they made the right choice in "Sticky Fingers".
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: I saw all the films at the theatre with the exception of House of Chthon which is a straight-to-video release, I believe, and does not feature Wesley Snipes.  The feature films were better, and Wesley Snipes moves as if he were born for this role.  The price was great, too.
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)

reviewText: I love the Blade franchise! So here is my review of this collection:1. BLADE:Wesley Snipes and Stephen Dorff were great opponents for each other! The battles were memorable!The characters each served a good purpose! My only complaint with this movie is that the moviehad a few dull moments in it! Aside from that, this movie was worth seeing! My grade: B+ orfour stars!2. BLADE 2:Wesley Snipes returns as the ultimate vampire hunter! But this time the vampires need his helpto fight and destroy a new breed of super mutant vampires! The plot held together well, didn'thave a dull moment at all in it, the characters and actors were all great, and Luke Goss gaveWesley Snipes a real challenge! One of few sequels that was better than the first! My grade:A- or four-and-a-half stars!3. Blade Trinity:Wesley Snipes is being hunted down by the lord of all Vampires; Dracula! Plus Blade is no longerfighting alone, now he fights along side new vampire hunters Hannibal King (Ryan Reynolds) andhis mentor's daughter Abigal Whistler (Jessica Beil)! This is the weakest of the Blade movies!The plot is nothing but a copy of the first two movie's plots, Ryan Reynold's wise cracks gotannoying after a while, Dracula looked like a body guard for a heavy metal rock star, Whistlerdying again was an over-kill on sympathy, the coloring on the film was crappy, and we couldhave found out more about some of the new characters, including Dracula!Overall, this movie was a disappointment to me, and I'm sure I'm not the only one who thoughtso...! My grade: C or two stars!4. Blade: House of Chthon:Basically a start to the Blade series! It's the first two episodes of the series to be exact!Jill Wagner plays a strong willed woman who is looking for her brother's killer... She laterfinds out that he was a familiar (a vampire wanna-be) And as she looks for the vampire who killedher brother, she runs into another who is hunting his killer, Blade (Kirk Jones)! The killers are;vampire over-lord Marcus Wright, his right hand man Fritz, and a beautiful vampire played byJessica Gower! Plus Blade uncovers a plot: the vampires are trying to create a super vampire!Well... it's made for T.V. so don't expect too much out of it... Kirk Jones looked more likethe original Blade from the comics, and all the actors were great! But the action sometimesfeels forced... sometimes, and the whole concept of a super vampire has been used in the franchisealready, but the plot is good, and it leaves us wanting more... so we have to watch the series tofind out what happens to everyone in the series! My grade: B- or three stars!The packaging was good except for one thing: Guiellmo DeTorro directed Blade 2, not Blade Trinity!Must have been an error with the packaging print... oh, well.Overall, if you don't want to pay for the movies separately this is not a bad find!Overall grade: B or three-and-a-half stars!
Title: 4 Film Favorites: Blade (Blade, Blade 2, Blade: House of Chthon, Blade: Trinity)
